answers.answer: I have a friend that used insulin.  She did okay but had to watch her weight, exercise, and take extra good care of herself.  The baby was born with only 1 kidney but the doc said it didn't have anything to do with the diabetes.  I hope your sister does well.blessings!

She will just have to be extra careful with her diet as the baby can get alot of sugar and may become big I had gd but was controlled by diet my babies were born early at 38 weeks but werent too big. A lady in my town just had twins by c section at 37 weeks they weighed 8lb 11oz and 9lb 4oz she is a little lady but has the type 1 diabetes which caused her babies to be so big. She will just have to have special care and be closely monitored through out her pregnancy.

My mom has juvenile diabetes (type 1). She was diagnosed when she was 2 years old and has taken insulin since. She had five healthy kids. My mom is very small (5'2" tall and only around 100-125 lbs) and all of us were big. She had two of us by cesarean and three of us natural. One of my sisters was a preemie and she weighed just over 7 lbs but the rest of us were between 8.5 and 10 lbs. I think the biggest concern of doctors is the size of the baby. That seems to be the only complication my mom had with all of us. The doctors will keep a close eye on your sister to make sure everything is okay.
